**Season twelve** of the [reality competition](/wiki/Reality_competition
"Reality competition") series _[America's Got
Talent](/wiki/America%27s_Got_Talent "America's Got Talent")_ was ordered on
August 2, 2016 and premiered on [NBC](/wiki/NBC "NBC") on Tuesday, May 30,
2017.[1] [Howie Mandel](/wiki/Howie_Mandel "Howie Mandel"), [Mel
B](/wiki/Mel_B "Mel B"), [Heidi Klum](/wiki/Heidi_Klum "Heidi Klum") and
[Simon Cowell](/wiki/Simon_Cowell "Simon Cowell") returned as judges for their
respective eighth, fifth, fifth and second seasons.[2] Supermodel and
businesswoman [Tyra Banks](/wiki/Tyra_Banks "Tyra Banks") replaced [Nick
Cannon](/wiki/Nick_Cannon "Nick Cannon"), who hosted for eight seasons, making
her the first female host of the show.[3] The live shows returned to the
[Dolby Theatre](/wiki/Dolby_Theatre "Dolby Theatre") in Los Angeles beginning
August 15, 2017.

The format of the show was the same as in [season
eleven](/wiki/America%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_11\) "America's Got Talent
\(season 11\)"), and [Dunkin Donuts](/wiki/Dunkin_Donuts "Dunkin Donuts")
sponsors the show for a third consecutive season.[4] A guest judge joined the
panel for each episode of the Judge Cuts round: [Chris
Hardwick](/wiki/Chris_Hardwick "Chris Hardwick"), [DJ Khaled](/wiki/DJ_Khaled
"DJ Khaled"), [Laverne Cox](/wiki/Laverne_Cox "Laverne Cox") and
[Seal](/wiki/Seal_\(musician\) "Seal \(musician\)").[5][6][7]

[Darci Lynne Farmer](/wiki/Darci_Lynne_Farmer "Darci Lynne Farmer") was named
the winner on the season finale, September 20, 2017. She was the third
ventriloquist, third child and third female to win a season of _America 's Got
Talent_. 10-year-old singer [Angelica Hale](/wiki/Angelica_Hale "Angelica
Hale") placed second, and glow light dance troupe [Light
Balance](/wiki/Light_Balance "Light Balance") came in third.[8] Farmer won the
show's prize of $1 million and a headlining performance in [Las
Vegas](/wiki/Las_Vegas "Las Vegas").[9]

On October 4, 2016, Simon Cowell signed a contract to remain as a judge
through 2019.[10]

Long-time host [Nick Cannon](/wiki/Nick_Cannon "Nick Cannon") announced, on
February 13, 2017, that he would not return as host for the twelfth season,
soon after he made disparaging remarks about NBC in his 2017
[Showtime](/wiki/Showtime_\(TV_network\) "Showtime \(TV network\)") comedy
special, _Stand Up, Don 't Shoot_.[11] Cannon was still under contract to
host, and NBC executives did not initially accept his resignation, but they
ultimately searched for a new host.[12][13]

On March 12, 2017, NBC announced supermodel and host [Tyra
Banks](/wiki/Tyra_Banks "Tyra Banks") as the host for Season 12.[3]

## Preliminary
auditions[[edit](/w/index.php?title=America%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_12\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Preliminary auditions")]

The season had preliminary open call auditions in [Chicago](/wiki/Chicago
"Chicago"), [Austin](/wiki/Austin,_Texas "Austin, Texas"),
[Cleveland](/wiki/Cleveland,_Ohio "Cleveland, Ohio"),
[Jacksonville](/wiki/Jacksonville,_Florida "Jacksonville, Florida"),
[Philadelphia](/wiki/Philadelphia "Philadelphia"), [Las Vegas](/wiki/Las_Vegas
"Las Vegas"), [San Diego](/wiki/San_Diego "San Diego"), New York City,
[Charleston](/wiki/Charleston,_South_Carolina "Charleston, South Carolina"),
[Memphis](/wiki/Memphis,_Tennessee "Memphis, Tennessee"), and [Los
Angeles](/wiki/Los_Angeles "Los Angeles").[14] As in years past, prospective
contestants could also submit online auditions.

Judges' auditions were taped in March at the [Pasadena Civic
Auditorium](/wiki/Pasadena_Civic_Auditorium "Pasadena Civic Auditorium") in
Los Angeles. The premiere aired May 30, 2017.[_[citation
needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

### Golden
buzzer[[edit](/w/index.php?title=America%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_12\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Golden buzzer")]

The Golden Buzzer returned for its fourth consecutive season. Any act that
received a golden buzzer during the preliminary auditions was sent directly to
the live shows and did not compete in the Judge Cuts round. In the first
episode of preliminary auditions, [Mel B](/wiki/Mel_B "Mel B") pressed the
golden buzzer for 12-year-old singing ventriloquist [Darci Lynne
Farmer](/wiki/Darci_Lynne_Farmer "Darci Lynne Farmer"). In subsequent
episodes, [Simon Cowell](/wiki/Simon_Cowell "Simon Cowell") pressed it for
29-year-old deaf singer [Mandy Harvey](/wiki/Mandy_Harvey "Mandy Harvey"),
[Howie Mandel](/wiki/Howie_Mandel "Howie Mandel") chose 16-year-old former
blind singer Christian Guardino, [Tyra Banks](/wiki/Tyra_Banks "Tyra Banks")
pressed it for [Light Balance](/wiki/Light_Balance "Light Balance") dance
crew, and [Heidi Klum](/wiki/Heidi_Klum "Heidi Klum") chose 13-year-old singer
Angelina Green.[15]

Each Judge Cuts act that received a golden buzzer advanced to the live shows
without any voting by the judges. During the Judge Cuts round, guest judges
[Chris Hardwick](/wiki/Chris_Hardwick "Chris Hardwick") pressed his golden
buzzer for 9-year old singer [Angelica Hale](/wiki/Angelica_Hale "Angelica
Hale"), [DJ Khaled](/wiki/DJ_Khaled "DJ Khaled") pressed it for 21-year old
singer-songwriter and guitarist Chase Goehring, [Laverne
Cox](/wiki/Laverne_Cox "Laverne Cox") pressed it for 9-year old singer Celine
Tam, and [Seal](/wiki/Seal_\(singer\) "Seal \(singer\)") pressed it for soul
singer Johnny Manuel.[15]

### Death of Brandon
Rogers[[edit](/w/index.php?title=America%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_12\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Death of Brandon Rogers")]

On June 11, 2017, contestant Brandon Rogers died in an automobile accident.
Rogers was an American physician who specialized in [family
medicine](/wiki/Family_medicine "Family medicine"). Earlier in 2017, after
seeing YouTube videos of Rogers singing, [Boyz II Men](/wiki/Boyz_II_Men "Boyz
II Men") invited him to sing with them as a guest in three of their [Las
Vegas](/wiki/Las_Vegas "Las Vegas") shows. His successful _AGT_ audition aired
on July 11, 2017, in his memory.[16] He competed in the Judge Cuts round, but
his performance in that round was not televised.[17]

## Judge
Cuts[[edit](/w/index.php?title=America%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_12\)&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Judge Cuts")]

The Judge Cuts round began on Tuesday, July 18, 2017. Like the previous
season, one guest judge joined the judges' panel each show and was given one
golden buzzer opportunity to send an act straight to the live shows. Twenty
acts were shown each week and seven advanced, including the guest judge's
golden buzzer choice. Guest judges were not given a red buzzer to use. Any act
that received all four red buzzers was immediately eliminated from the
competition. The four guest judges were Chris Hardwick, DJ Khaled, Laverne
Cox, and Seal.

After the Judge Cuts, three wildcards were chosen from eliminated acts to
perform in the live shows: Final Draft, Bello Nock and Oskar and Gaspar (who
did not perform in the Judge Cuts round). All three of these acts were
eliminated in the Quarterfinals.

##
Quarterfinals[[edit](/w/index.php?title=America%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_12\)&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: Quarterfinals")]

The quarterfinals were broadcast live from the [Dolby
Theatre](/wiki/Dolby_Theatre "Dolby Theatre") in Los Angeles starting on
August 15, 2017. They featured the nine golden buzzer acts, the 24 other acts
promoted during the Judge Cuts round, and three wildcard acts chosen by the
producers and judges. Twelve acts performed each week, with results announced
the on following nights; each week seven acts were sent through to the
semifinals.[18] Puddles Pity Party and Mirror Image received an "X" in the
Quarterfinals. Demian Aditya received "X's" by Mel B and Cowell in the second
Quarterfinals.

voted to the semifinals, plus the judges' semifinal wildcard pick. Each week,
eleven acts performed; five went through to the finals, and six were
eliminated. No acts were buzzed.

Chase Goehring | 2 | _Singer-Songwriter/Guitarist_ ; performed an original song called "Mirror". | Top 10

[Mandy Harvey](/wiki/Mandy_Harvey "Mandy Harvey") | 9 | _Singer-Songwriter/Ukeleleist_ ; performed an original song called "This Time". | Advanced

## Contestants who appeared on other seasons or
shows[[edit](/w/index.php?title=America%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_12\)&action=edit&section=23
"Edit section: Contestants who appeared on other seasons or shows")]

  * [Demian Aditya](https://id.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demian_Aditya "id:Demian Aditya") appeared as a guest performer on _[Indonesia's Got Talent](/wiki/Indonesia%27s_Got_Talent "Indonesia's Got Talent")_.
  * [German Cornejo & Gisela Galeassi](/wiki/German_Cornejo_%26_Gisela_Galeassi "German Cornejo & Gisela Galeassi") ("German Cornejo Dance Company") appeared on and were the tango dancer winners of _[¡Q'Viva! The Chosen](/wiki/%C2%A1Q%27Viva!_The_Chosen "¡Q'Viva! The Chosen")_ in 2012, performing after the show in Las Vegas with _[¡Q'Viva! The Chosen Live](/wiki/%C2%A1Q%27Viva!_The_Chosen_Live "¡Q'Viva! The Chosen Live")_. They also were guest artists in Buenos Aires at the _[Dance Again World Tour](/wiki/Dance_Again_World_Tour "Dance Again World Tour")_ by [Jennifer Lopez](/wiki/Jennifer_Lopez "Jennifer Lopez").
  * Ezequiel Lopez ("German Cornejo Dance Company") appeared on and was one of the malambo dancer winners of _[¡Q'Viva! The Chosen](/wiki/%C2%A1Q%27Viva!_The_Chosen "¡Q'Viva! The Chosen")_ in 2012.
  * Canion Shijirbat appeared on and was the runner-up of [_Mongolia 's Got Talent_](/wiki/Mongolia%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_2\) "Mongolia's Got Talent \(season 2\)") in 2016. He appeared on [_Asia 's Got Talent_](/wiki/Asia%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_2\) "Asia's Got Talent \(season 2\)") a few months after _America’s Got Talent_ and was given a Golden Buzzer by the hosts.
  * Nick Uhas was a houseguest on _[Big Brother 15](/wiki/Big_Brother_15_\(U.S.\) "Big Brother 15 \(U.S.\)")_ and was the second houseguest evicted from the house.
  * Merrick Hanna auditioned for _[So You Think You Can Dance: The Next Generation](/wiki/So_You_Think_You_Can_Dance:_The_Next_Generation_\(U.S._TV_series\) "So You Think You Can Dance: The Next Generation \(U.S. TV series\)")_. He made it into the top 40 at Dance Academy, but was eliminated before reaching the top 30.[69] He has also appeared as a lip sync battler on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon")'s _Lip Sync Battle Shorties_ and on _[The Ellen DeGeneres Show](/wiki/The_Ellen_DeGeneres_Show "The Ellen DeGeneres Show")_.[70]
  * Artyon, half of the dancing duo Artyon and Paige, appeared as a lip sync battler on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon")'s _Lip Sync Battle Shorties_.
  * Darci Lynne Farmer appeared on _[Little Big Shots](/wiki/Little_Big_Shots "Little Big Shots")_ in 2016 and on _[Little Big Shots (UK TV series)](/wiki/Little_Big_Shots_\(UK_TV_series\) "Little Big Shots \(UK TV series\)")_ in 2017.
  * Billy and Emily England appeared on _[Britain's Got Talent (series 9)](/wiki/Britain%27s_Got_Talent_\(series_9\) "Britain's Got Talent \(series 9\)")_ and reached the Semifinals. In 2008, Emily was the runner-up on _[Big Brother UK: Celebrity Hijack](/wiki/Big_Brother:_Celebrity_Hijack "Big Brother: Celebrity Hijack")_ , competing under the name of "Emilia."
  * Tony and Jordan ("The French Twins") appeared on series 11 of _[La France a un incroyable talent](/wiki/La_France_a_un_incroyable_talent "La France a un incroyable talent")_(the French version of Got Talent) in 2016.
  * Chase Goehring appeared on _[The X Factor (U.S. season 3)](/wiki/The_X_Factor_\(U.S._season_3\) "The X Factor \(U.S. season 3\)")_.
  * Christian Guardino appeared on [Showtime at the Apollo](/wiki/Showtime_at_the_Apollo "Showtime at the Apollo") in 2016.
  * Light Balance appeared on _[Britain's Got Talent (series 8)](/wiki/Britain%27s_Got_Talent_\(series_8\) "Britain's Got Talent \(series 8\)")_ and reached the Semifinals.
  * Junior and Emily appeared on Season 3 of America's Got Talent, but were eliminated before the live shows.
  * Shemika Charles appeared on Season 6 of America's Got Talent, but was eliminated during Vegas week.
  * Celine Tam appeared on _[Little Big Shots](/wiki/Little_Big_Shots "Little Big Shots")_ in 2016 _and[Britain's Got Talent (series 10)](/wiki/Britain%27s_Got_Talent_\(series_10\) "Britain's Got Talent \(series 10\)")_ but had to drop out due to a visa issue.
  * Vinny Grosso ("The Naked Magician") previously appeared on "Penn and Teller: Fool Us", performing the same routine as his AGT Audition, and successfully fooling the magic duo.
  * The [Quiddlers](/wiki/Quiddlers "Quiddlers") participated in the [third season](/wiki/America%27s_Got_Talent_\(season_3\) "America's Got Talent \(season 3\)") and appeared on _[I Can Do That](/wiki/I_Can_Do_That_\(U.S._TV_series\) "I Can Do That \(U.S. TV series\)")_ , performing with [Ciara](/wiki/Ciara "Ciara") and [Nicole Scherzinger](/wiki/Nicole_Scherzinger "Nicole Scherzinger") during their time on the show.
  * Eric Jones previously appeared on "Penn and Teller: Fool us, and he was successful in fooling them. Kyle Eschen & Xavier Mortimer also appeared on Fool Us (Mortimer twice), but were unsuccessful in fooling Penn & Teller.
  * Xavier Mortimer auditioned in Season 10, but was eliminated at the judge cuts after receiving four buzzers.
  * Pelican 212 appeared on _[Little Big Shots](/wiki/Little_Big_Shots "Little Big Shots")_ in 2016.
  * Kyle Eschen appeared on Season 3, episode 2 of [Penn & Teller: Fool Us](/wiki/Penn_%26_Teller:_Fool_Us "Penn & Teller: Fool Us"), _Masters of Illusion_ , and _The World Magic Awards._
  * Colin Cloud appeared on Britain's Got Talent in 2012, but he did not make it through to the live semifinals. Cloud also appeared on Season 1 of Penn and Teller Fool Us. His trick didn't however fool Penn and Teller. At both BGT and Penn and Teller Fool Us he went under his real name Colin McLeod.
